verses.verse: “If I cause (Lev. 26:22; Num. 21:6; Ezek. 5:17; 14:21) wild beasts to pass through the land, and they empty it, and make it so desolate that no man may pass through because of the beasts,

even (Ezek. 14:14, 18, 20) though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters; only they would be delivered, and the land would be (Ezek. 15:8; 33:28, 29) desolate.
“Or if (Lev. 26:25; Ezek. 5:12; 21:3, 4; 29:8; 38:21) I bring a sword on that land, and say, ‘Sword, go through the land,’ and I (Ezek. 25:13; Zeph. 1:3) cut off man and beast from it,
even (Ezek. 14:14) though these three men were in it, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “they would deliver neither sons nor daughters, but only they themselves would be delivered.
“Or if I send (2 Sam. 24:15; Ezek. 38:22) a pestilence into that land and (Ezek. 7:8) pour out My fury on it in blood, and cut off from it man and beast,
even (Ezek. 14:14) though Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live,” says the Lord GOD, “they would deliver neither son nor daughter; they would deliver only themselves by their righteousness.”

For thus says the Lord GOD: “How much more it shall be when (Ezek. 5:17; 33:27; Amos 4:6-10; Rev. 6:8) I send My four severe judgments on Jerusalem—the sword and famine and wild beasts and pestilence—to cut off man and beast from it?

(2 Kin. 25:11, 12; Ezra 2:1; Ezek. 12:16; 36:20) Yet behold, there shall be left in it a remnant who will be (Ezek. 6:8) brought out, both sons and daughters; surely they will come out to you, and (Ezek. 20:43) you will see their ways and their doings. Then you will be comforted concerning the disaster that I have brought upon Jerusalem, all that I have brought upon it.
